reviews.review_msg: Enjoyed the class. Professor was kind, accommodating, and caring. Mike, the TA, was amazing.

Best lab I've taken at SFU (I've taken 7). He actually cares whether you understand your results. Focus is on understanding the purpose/outcome of each experiment, not simply performing tasks and getting good results. Questions are encouraged and he answers them insightfully. Pro tip: visit office hours to go over lab reports before submitting.

Niikura was an amazing lab prof. 30% of the grade is just from showing up and the rest is on 7 lab reports. There's no penalty if your lab is unsuccesful. His accent might be hard to understand, but don't be afraid to ask questions! He really makes sure you understand your results which you write about in the lab reports.

This class was really fun and enjoyable! As long as you show up for the lab for the whole semester, you get a free 30% of the grade. The rest of the grade is based on lab reports which are easy as well. Just make sure you know what you are doing, why and interpret the results based on whether your experiment failed or worked and explain in report.
